data.title: Jacob Fatu injured after SummerSlam spot
data.meta_description: The Samoan Werewolf looks to be on the WWE disabled list but for how long we aren't sure. data.meta_site_name: Slam Wrestling - Pro Wrestling Journalism at its Finest.
data.text:
The Samoan Werewolf looks to be on the WWE disabled list but for how long we aren’t sure.

Jacob Fatu was seen by fans wearing an orthopedic boot after his appearance at SummerSlam.

Those boots can be prescribed for anywhere from one to six weeks so it is hard to know without official word whether Fatu has damaged his foot or his ankle and how bad the injury is.

Fatu damaged his foot diving from the ring to the announce table on a prone Cody Rhodes. Fatu staggered to his feet after the move and could be seen delivering frantic instructions to Solo Sikoa on how to proceed without him. It is clear that a returning Roman Reigns was supposed to rescue Rhodes from Fatu and Solo but with Fatu incapacitated WWE called an audible and had Reign lay out Solo when Rhodes really didn’t need much assistance, had things well in hand.

Fatu was spotted being unable to walk and had to be assisted to the back after suffering the injury.
